text: Lillian Vernon (born Lilli Menasche; March 18, 1927 - December 14, 2015) was an American businesswoman, entrepreneur, and philanthropist. She founded the Lillian Vernon Corporation in 1951 and served as its chairman and CEO until July 1989, though she continued to serve as executive chairman until 2003. == Personal life == Vernon was born in Leipzig, Germany. Because they were of Jewish descent the Vernon family fled to the United States in 1937.New York Times Vernon died from congestive heart failure in Manhattan, New York City at the age of 88."Lillian Vernon, creator of a bustling catalog business dies at 88", nytimes.com; accessed December 15, 2015. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American chief executives Category:American Jews Category:American philanthropists Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Deaths from congestive heart failure Category:German Jews Category:Jewish businesspeople Category:Jewish philanthropists Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:People from Leipzig Category:Refugees from Nazism Category:Writers from New York City
